metadata.title: CVE-2012-2672 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Oracle Mojarra 2.1.7 does not properly "clean up" the FacesContextreference during startup, which allows local users to obtain contextinformation an access resources from another WAR file by calling theFacesContext.getCurrentInstance function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjsf-api-java - 2.2.8-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mojarra package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.8-2').
